campaign.story:
”I first read this as a screenplay. Having myself experienced what can happen when a screenplay becomes a graphic novel, to say I'm excited by this Kickstarter is very much an understatement!” — William Gibson
MADI is a 260-page road trip graphic novel set in the near future, by film director Duncan Jones (MOON, SOURCE CODE) and writer Alex de Campi (BAD KARMA, BLADE RUNNER), and drawn by some of comics’ most exciting artists including Glenn Fabry, Simon Bisley, Duncan Fegredo and Pia Guerra. Each artist tackles a 8-30 page section of the story, bringing to life one location.
See for yourself: Download the first 19 pages of MADI here! Includes both the Fegredo/Phillips and Shimizu covers.
 This project is EU/UK shipping friendly! We are drop-shipping to a UK distributor so shipping is affordable to our huge and beloved European fanbase. Estimated maximum shipping costs for a single book are: US: $10 / Canada & Mexico: $15 / UK: $20 / Mainland Europe: $25 / Rest of World: $55. Shipping costs will be collected at checkout (after the campaign ends) via Backerkit, where you’ll also have the chance to add on additional books or upgrade to a higher-tier book. 
Madi Preston, a veteran of Britain’s elite special operations J-Squad unit, is burnt out and up to her eyeballs in debt. She and the rest of her team have retired from the military but are now trapped having to pay to service and maintain the technology put into them during their years of service.   They're working for British conglomerate Liberty Inc as  mercenaries, selling their unique ability to be remote controlled by specialists while in the field, and the debts are only growing as they get injured completing missions. We meet Madi as she decides she’s had enough.  She will take an off-the-books job that should earn her enough to pay out her and her sister, but when the piece of tech she’s supposed to steal turns out to be a kid, and she suddenly blacks out... she finds herself on the run from everyone she’s ever known. 
In a globe-spanning adventure from Shanghai to Soho, Madi has to stay one step ahead of the giant corporations closing in on her from all sides. 
MADI is the third and final story in the “Mooniverse,” an anthology of independent stories that take place in a shared future. You don’t need to have seen MOON or MUTE to fully enjoy this standalone book.
The full roster of line artists are: Dylan Teague, Glenn Fabry, Duncan Fegredo, LRNZ, Ed Ocaña, André Araújo, Simon Bisley, Rosemary Valero-O’Connell, Tonci Zonjic, Pia Guerra, James Stokoe, RM Guéra, Chris Weston,  Rufus Dayglo, Annie Wu, David Lopez and Christian Ward. Our amazing colour team includes: Matt Wilson, Nayoung Kim, Chris O’Halloran, Adam Brown, Jacob Phillips, Raúl Arnaiz, Giulia Brusco, Sergey Nazarov and Kelly Fitzpatrick. Lettering is by Alex. 
Every artist has been paid their full asking rate and is also getting royalties on the project. As freelancers ourselves, we believe in being the change we want to see in the industry.  
The book is almost finished being drawn and is currently being lettered. It will be sent to backers in early November, and comes in your choice of a luxe 7¼ X 10 ½” paperback, a 8.3” x 12” hardback (the original art size), or an oversize 10 x 14½” cased hardback with over 40 pages of back matter. The paperback cover is by Duncan Fegredo & Jacob Phillips, and the hardback cover is by Yuko Shimizu. 
Duncan Fegredo and Jacob Phillips' beautiful wrap cover for the paperback edition
Because both Duncan and Alex have big fanbases in Europe we are doing our damnedest to make sure shipping is as inexpensive as possible while maintaining safe and careful mailing of these extremely nice, high quality editions. We're working with drop-shipping to UK distributors so European buyers won't have to pay airmail from the US.  Backerkit is handling all our pledge management and will be charging shipping at the end, once the campaign is over (you'll also be able to add on books or upgrade your pledge at that time, if you want). Z2 has its own warehouse, so US fulfillment can be handled easily and professionally in-house. 
No digital version of MADI will be made available at this time, or indeed maybe ever.
Stores, you will be able to order MADI for retail sale at your fine shops a few weeks after Kickstarter fulfillment.  
Yuko Shimizu's luscious cover for the hardback edition
A model of Yuko's cover on the hardback, without logos (why interrupt the pretty until you have to)
The deluxe slipcase edition is truly a magnificent book, with the art reproduced at luscious 10” x 14.5” size (a 20% blowup on the book’s original art size of 8.3” x 12”) and with over 60 pages of extras, process, and essays from Duncan and Alex, along with surprise bonus art from friends like Colleen Doran and Jeffrey Veregge! See a scene go from original screenplay through Alex’s handwritten breakdowns to comic script, pencils, inks, then colours! Pore over the thumbnails and rough layouts of masters like Duncan Fegredo and RM Guéra! Enjoy all the character sketches and development work that went on behind the scenes (there was a lot, this project was super complex to produce) such as Annie Wu’s amazing Kitty Cop concept art, below! (The whole Kitty Cop origin story is pretty great, too, it basically involves Alex + too much sugar.) 
The Madi deluxe edition with diecut slipcase
The slipcase edition features Yuko’s gorgeous wrap cover without logos, inside a diecut slipcase that allows Yuko’s illustration of Madi to show through. This slipcase edition will not be available for retail sale; if you miss it here, maybe we might have a few at the Z2 Comics table at a convention, but maybe not. 
Annie Wu’s concept art for our Kitty Cops, or: “kawaii, but make it fascism”
Duncan Fegredo's lovely wrap cover for the softcover edition, before its colours by Jacob Phillips!
A Simon BIsley warmup sketch, as you do; another of the sort of extras that only come in the deluxe slipcase edition
Also, neither Duncan nor Alex have ANY chill so we'll probably post lots of lettered pages in the updates.... but only for backers.  
Duncan's last "Free the 156" stickers from MUTE, for the first 50 hardcover backers
 Who we are:
Man; made Moon & more
Duncan Jones is a British advertising and film director, best known for his BAFTA winning film MOON, epic game-based fantasy movie WARCRAFT and his other science fiction films SOURCE CODE & MUTE.  He is presently staying safely locked up at his home, waiting for it to be safe to go out and make ROGUE TROOPER of 2000AD fame with Rebellion Studios.  Duncan is answerable to his wife, Rodene, his two kids, Stenton 4 and Zowie 2, and his dog, who takes her privacy very seriously after a scamming incident, and wishes to remain anonymous. 
Woman; made books
Alex de Campi is a novellist and comics writer, best known for her noir graphic novel BAD GIRLS and her love anthology TWISTED ROMANCE, both of which were nominated for three Eisner awards last year. She has also written some episodes of Shinichiro Watanabe’s BLADE RUNNER anime (on Toonami next year) and worked with Masamune Shirow on a GHOST IN THE SHELL comic for Kodansha. Her debut novel, medieval suspense thriller THE SCOTTISH BOY, comes out at the end of the month and you can preorder it here in the UK or here in the US. You can read her action-thriller comic BAD KARMA anywhere in the world right now, as it is pay-what-you-wish on lovely webcomic site Panel Syndicate. Alex is answerable to her daughter Lorelei and her deafblind pit bull Tango, and they’re all answerable to the darn cat. Her little family is currently enjoying being the only people left in Manhattan.

updates.update_content:
Mainland Europe: All of the books are now shipping, however the last part of the process is the DHL notification. You may ask if they started the process Friday the 7th why is it taking so long well May 13th is a national holiday in Germany and the fulfillment center was closed for it and the 12th. That said everything is almost all packed and DHL notifications will start going out as the last part of the process. Apologies on this, but of the fulfillment this is the hardest part as we are dealing with a 9 hour time difference, a language barrier, and multiple software systems


UK: We are interfacing with our shipping company about all missing and damaged orders to get that fixed. We do need a bit of time especially with damages as we do not handle directly ourselves.

Backerkit: Now we noticed recently there was a surge of people filling in their Backerkit incredibly late. If you did so you will get your books, but we based out warehouse allocations on the Backerkit data. With Z2's normal shipping operations we can pull it automatically but with Backerkit we manually have to refresh pull and put in our system. ( It's why we sent out so many notices on it). In other words, if you JUST paid your Backerkit, your books will be a couple weeks behind everyone else’s books that are already paid / in the system.

If there are any issues with an individual order please email rather than message the Kickstarter or comment we have people there ready to help and it will go a lot quicker than commenting. When you mail support, please provide your name, your full mailing address, and what you ordered / what’s missing. If it’s about a damaged book, please include a photo of the damage.

Thank you all for your patience

campaign.story:
In 2014, I made a blacklight screen print with fluorescent ink with Telegraph Art & Comics. This is it: 
It made me think, why hasn't anyone made a blacklight comic book with fluorescent ink? These colors are so bright! It would be the best looking comic book ever.
So I decided to make one. It's called OCTOBRIANA 1976. 
OCTOBRIANA 1976 preview
It's about a badass Russian superhero/devil-woman who fights Soviet oppression and robot Stalin.
OCTOBRIANA 1976 preview
It's set in the 1970s because when I think of blacklight art, I think of the 70s. Plus the story is inspired by underground comix of the 70s.
OCTOBRIANA 1976 preview
Octobriana comes from the book Octobriana and the Russian Underground (1971) by Petr Sadecky. It's about a subversive group of artists and writers in Kiev in the 1960s who create a western-style superhero character as an act of dissent. They made outlaw comics called samizdat (publish-it-yourself <-- reminds me of zines in the US or dojinshi in Japan) that starred Octobriana. Sadecky smuggled this material out of the USSR for his book. Since then, Octobriana has appeared in several comic books across many decades and countries. She seemed like a perfect character for American underground comix - a show of solidarity with their Russian countercultural kin. 
Of course some of that is not true. It's a great book that reminds me of things like Orson Welles' War of the Worlds and F for Fake, Spinal Tap, or H.P. Lovecraft's mythology (specifically the way other writers are free to use his creations). Here is a Cartoonist Kayfabe video that Ed Piskor and I made about Sadecky's book:
OCTOBRIANA 1976 preview
In order to make this work, I'm teaming up with my frequent partner-in-creative - AdHouse Books' Chris Pitzer. Pitzer's my print guru. We first teamed up on the 1970s superhero graphic novel Afrodisiac. It featured some unusual printing/coloring/design to approximate the look of the time period: 
We also did Street Angel: Princess of Poverty. This was the first time I worked with fluorescent ink in offset printing (the cover lettering and spine). It's not the same as other ink. For example, you need to print it twice to "charge" it:
So when I first thought about making a blacklight comic book with fluorescent ink, I talked to AdHouse Books. His expertise is the reason this is going to be the best looking comic book ever!
REWARDS
UPDATE!!! I've created 3 editions of the digital OCTOBRIANA 1976 - Neon, Retro, and Black-and-white! These will be sent to everyone who backs this Kickstarter starting at the $5 level! Here are samples. I'm also making comic book editions of the retro and black-and-white versions:
REWARDS
OCTOBRIANA 1976 - DIGITAL EDITIONS 
Read these on your computer or mobile device. Because the fluorescent color doesn't translate well to the screen, I decided to create a custom digital copy of Octobriana 1976. The coloring is different than the print edition but I tried to make it look its best for your screen!
PROCESS: OCTOBRIANA 1976 ZINE
This is a cross between a how-to book and an Artist Edition. It features my script, layouts, sketches, and scans of the original art that went into the creation of Octobriana 1976.
OCTOBRIANA 1976 - PRINT EDITION 
This is why we're all here - 24 page, saddle-stitched comic book featuring bright, fluorescent colors! Is it the best looking comic book ever? Get one and decide for yourself. If you or someone you know loves comics, printed matter, or design - this is for you!
 UPDATE!!! I've created 3 editions of the digital OCTOBRIANA 1976 - Neon, Retro, and Black-and-white! I like how they look so I'm going to make limited print editions of the Retro and Black-and-white versions. If you've already chosen another Reward but you'd like to add these variant editions - you will be able to add them when you check out at the end of this campaign:
BLACKLIGHT SCREEN PRINTS Signed and Numbered
In addition to the comic book, I'm offering signed and numbered blacklight screen prints as rewards, including the Dragon Killer print that started this journey plus an Octobriana print and Afrodisiac print - it is her Kickstarter after all! You can also get a set of all three for a nice price. Prints are 18 x 24 inches.   
UPDATE: Afrodisiac package REWARD is now available - Octobriana 1976 comic book + Afrodisiac book + Afrodisiac blacklight screen print
UPDATE: I have added 2 prints for a very limited 5 print set. The 2 prints are from previous print runs and limited quantities. One is a blacklight screen print based on Alexis Ziritt's comic book Space Riders. The other is a 3D screen print for Plan 9 from Outer Space. Both prints are 18 x 24 inches.

ART
Octobriana drawings on comic book backing boards. The drawings pictured below are samples of what some of these backboard drawings look like. The drawings will vary since each is a unique, one-of-a-kind drawing and not a print.  Backing boards are approximately 6.75 x 10.5 inches. Media is pencil, ink, marker, paint, highlighter, color pencil, or mixed media. The backing board will be in a plastic sleeve along with your copy of Octobriana 1976 comic book. 
ORIGINAL ART: STRETCH GOAL BOOKPLATE DRAWING
The original art for the Stretch Goal Bookplate/Signed Print. It is ink on bristol, 11 x 17 inches.
ORIGINAL ART: DRAGONKILLER
The original art from the Dragonkiller blacklight print is now available. It is archival ink on bristol, 18 x 24 inches.
Detail:
There are a few concept drawings available as rewards. These are character drawings that I made when I was working out the designs, materials, and style of OCTOBRIANA 1976. These concept drawings are 11 x 17, ink on bristol.  
Concept drawing 1
Concept drawing 2
Concept drawing 3
The cover art is also a Reward and 11 x 17, ink and screen tone on bristol.

STRETCH GOALS
UNLOCKED! $60,000 - Octobriana Checklist: Old school fanzine style! Where else has Octobriana appeared? I'll try to make a comprehensive list of appearances in comic books as well as real world media.
$75,000 - Signed bookplate/print: This will be included with the Print edition OCTOBRIANA 1976 fluorescent, blacklight comic book. It will feature a new drawing and design by Jim Rugg! I'm not saying it will be from OCTOBRIANA 1986...but that was a magical year for comics. I'm sure the goddess of war had something to say about it!
FINAL NOTE
Eventually I plan to distribute this comic book anywhere and everywhere that I can. This includes comic book shops, conventions, and online. I do not know how those details will unfold, but I want to be honest about my intentions. My goal is to make comics accessible to readers everywhere. 
Thank you for your support and read more comics!

campaign.story:
Drip: Extreme swag. I.E. “Look at my drip, my drip, my swag” - Lil Baby.
Drip: A collection of drawings from Shawn Crystal.
Hi, I’m Shawn Crystal and I'm a massive fan of Hip Hop. As a storyteller, Hip hop has always spoken to me. Rappers used word and rhyme schemes to paint pictures and create characters with a unique style and swag, much like I do with drawings and paintings. The first time I heard hip hop it owned my soul. I grew up breakdancing and graffiti writing. Comics and Hip Hop have always shared a brotherhood, and that has influenced who I am,  for most of my life.
I’m also a comic book artist, illustrator, art educator, and podcaster. I’ve worked for Marvel Comics and DC Comics for the past decade on titles such as Deadpool, Batman, Mother Panic, Guardians of the Galaxy, and Scarlet Witch (to name a few.)
I’m also the host of the Inkpulp Audio podcast, where I interview creative people and talk about their lives and art.
My first art book was titled “represent.”  It was my debut art book and I wanted to name it after the greatest rap debut of all time, “Illmatic” by Nas. The book was re-presenting a few years worth of work in one new collection. Also, I wanted it to “represent” me, much like the song “represent” did for Nas.
When it came time to title my second art book, I thought back to the growth that I have gone through, as an artist, over the past four years. I’ve progressed tremendously and I am excited to share that growth with all of you. When it comes to my art,  I feel a sense of swag. The times being what they are, hip hop is full of swag… drippin hard. So "Drip" seemed like a natural title.
Also, my logo is that of an ink drop. The title “Drip” offered that same double meaning that I had found with my first art book. A perfect fit.
  DRIP: The Art of Shawn Crystal
This art book collects work produced by me over the past four years. As an artist, this time has been a period of growth for me. For years I've been feeling like I was searching to find myself as an artist, mostly. Here, in this book, is where I finally nailed down who I am as an artist and what makes my art unique and “mine.” I am proudly presenting this new collection of ink drawings, pencil sketches, thumbnails, commissions, and studies in a beautifully designed edition. The book has a soft cover, measures 7.5” X 11” and has a CLASSY Spot gloss DRIP.
We have created some exciting  REWARD TIERS for you all to choose from!
We also have some extremely exciting STRETCH GOALS planned!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
My biggest challenge will be getting the word out about this Kickstarter. I feel like I'm comics best kept secret, just like Diamond D. I am very proud of the work in this book and believe any fan of comic art will find this to be an essential part of their art library.
My second biggest challenge will be the commissions. I plan on working on them full time once this campaign is funded. That means I won't be taking on freelance work for that time period. In order to do that, I need to make enough money to support myself during that period. Again, any help spreading the word will drive those numbers up and make this a total success. 
My first kickstarter campaign was fulfilled on time. I always work really hard to deliver my work on time, and this Kickstarter will be no exception! The book is completely designed and ready to hit the press. Once funded we will hit go.
I am aiming to have everything, printed, done, and shipped out by July 2020, at the absolute latest.

Our Story
Hi Everyone, 
Thank you so much for visiting our campaign. We are Kirsten and Aiyven Mbawa and we have written 2 books which we hope to publish in April 2020 with your support. 
Let us tell you a bit about ourselves, our books and the inspiration for them. 
We’ve been reading since forever. We have also been writing from when we were about 7 or 8 years old. Our love for reading & writing started with our grandfather. He loved to read. He adored buying books, often from charity shops. So, in every home he stayed at (his in Cameroon, ours/our aunt’s in Northampton or our uncle’s in Ferrara), he would have stacks of books. Our mum inherited that love for reading and then writing and so did we. We also think another source of our flair for writing is our granduncle (our dad's uncle). He had a newspaper back in Cameroon called the Cameroon Post which was quite a thing its day.
Follow this link to our YouTube Channel where you can watch some videos of us sharing our love for reading & writing by reviewing books for children, teen and young adults.
Learn About Our Stories & Meet The Characters
Sagas Of Anya by Kirsten (12) is a work of historical fiction depicting a heart-breaking Victorian day tale which follows Anya from Cardiff to a life of drudgery in London.  Anya is 11 when mother dies. Her cosy life upends as life goes on a downward spiral. After 2 years of watching her father and her perfect life fade away, she has little choice but to head to London to be a maid at the impressive Tippets House working for the nasty Mrs. Axton. Told from a child’s perspective, it charts the courageous journey of a motherless daughter beyond death and grief to become a strong, determined and independent survivor.  
Anya
Sagas Of Anya Characters
Land Of the Nurogons by Aiyven (10) is a gripping fantasy adventure undertaken by 4 “ordinary” teenagers to save the world they fell into & have come to love. Through the eyes of Hayden, Canada, Rodger & Mae, you will experience the highs and lows of the quests they go on with the help of the Nurogons & Lord Nurogi to save Nurogonia. When you get to tuck into the book, you’ll find friendship, loyalty, bravery and teamwork are central to this story. 
Hayden
Land Of The Nurogons Characters
Sagas Of Anya & Land Of The Nurogons Colouring Book (PDF)
The Inspiration
Our books started life when Nana Juju, our nanny, encouraged us to enter the BBC 500 Words competition in early 2019. We entered the main idea for these stories but unfortunately, we didn't get a favourable reply.  Land Of The Nurogons is inspired by Rick Riordan, one of Aiyven’s favourite authors, if not her favourite author. Sagas Of Anya is loosely based on our mum as our maternal grandma sadly passed away when our mum was quite young too. Anya's mum, therefore, is in honour of our grandma. 
Thank you Nana Juju for encouraging us to enter the competition. Even though we didn't win, Mum and Dad encouraged us to carry on with our books, so we turned them into tens of thousands of words, let alone 500. Thank you, Mum & Dad, for supporting us and keeping us on track. Thank you Dad for getting us the laptops! Even though Mum thought it was too early at the time:-) Thank you Everyone who has supported us on this writing journey and also supported us with our book reviews. 
We think by achieving our dream of becoming published authors, we will add more diversity to the community of writers because these stories for children & young people are being told & written by young people.
We are hoping to get our books published through your support for our Kickstarter Campaign so in the first instance, we will only print as many copies as are ordered through Kickstarter. When our Kickstarter campaign ends, there will be updates on any other ways of pre-ordering the books before the official release date of 18th April 2020. Please do well to support us so we can keep our writing talent in use.

The Fans
 Thousands of  Authors, Parents, Children, and others have been following us since we launched our Book Review Youtube channel just under a year ago and these fans have stayed with us since giving us great encouragement to write our own books.

campaign.story:
Front Cover by David Mack, Back Cover by Jason Shawn Alexander
David Mack original art rewards
 What could make a man of God lose all faith? 
What happens when everything that man once believed turns out to be true? Almost.... 
Punch is the unholy prow splitting the water between life and death, faith and doubt, hope and damnation.
A heartbroken priest defies his faith and commits an unforgivable sin. He finds God and the Devil casting lots in a seedy bar for his eternal soul. There's a bar fight between God's infernal Virtues, the Hounds of Heaven, and the Devil's seven deadly sins; survivors of the homicidal pogroms perpetrated by the One God against the many. 
The tale begins with the body of a man wrapped in plastic in the trunk of a car. Our protagonist is a Catholic priest- a haunted, unshaven preacher - The Drifter - who has just killed a man; an act so heinous that he despairs of his immortal soul. He received a confession of the dead man’s sins - a confession so hideous, so monstrous, that our priest had no choice but to kill the man then and there. He rips the clerical collar from his neck and walks out into the desert, certain he'll die of exposure, which technically isn’t suicide.
He finds a bar instead. Purgatory is a roadhouse with Satan as the bartender, fronted by seven women, his 7 Deadly Sins, while God - a filthy derelict - begs for spare change outside. The Drifter searches his pockets - finds only two coins. He throws one into the derelict’s lap and enters the bar. He walks to the bar where the Devil is waiting with a drink already poured. The Drifter pays for the drink with the second coin.
He downs the drink. 
 Throwing off his disguise as a derelict, God enters the bar. He has seven silver chain leashes in his hands - and on the end of each leash is a woman in a collar. These are the seven virtues. They wear white uniforms. The Virtues are immaculately made up and angelic - but they behave like wolves. They strain at the leash and howl like attack dogs.
The Devil tips his glass.
And the fight begins for the Drifter’s soul. Virtues vs Vice, the ultimate bar brawl between what used to pass for Good and Evil. But the Drifter isn’t so sure where the lines are anymore. God smiles from behind his mirror shades and drags the howling Drifter out of the bar into the searing pitiless light of Heaven.
But nothing is as it seems; the Drifter plans a celestial jailbreak, and the Morning Star, cunning to the last, has manipulated events from the start. The Drifter begins to understand his position as a lever, capable of destabilizing the balance of power and rescuing the one soul he sought to avenge at the very start.   
Five years ago, legendary comics writer Grant Morrison and I started working on an uncanny history of the once and future gods, called PUNCH. Sadly, even with the best of intentions, Grant had multiple projects in development at that time. And when HAPPY! went to FX, the heavens opened, and his already full plate was loaded up a thousand fold. That might have been the end of Punch, if not for Grant's encouragement that I continue with the script myself, and his continued enthusiasm when I inundated his poor inbox with pages and pages of high falutin' verbiage. Always listen to a legend when they give you advice, and then make them suffer for it! It took  4 years of writing and revision, and in 2019, I found myself with a sprawling 78 page script, and a quixotic "Now What!?" reverberating in my mushy skull.  
Enter Kickstarter, the perfect agora to communicate with some of the most ardent comic book fans in the world. The hallowed medium via which so many indie comic book raconteurs bring their wildest and most personal stories to life! The script is written. Jonathan Marks Barravecchia, myself, and the rest of the creative team are already hard at work, thumb nailing and illustrating the graphic novel. But even with the contributions of comics and art legends like BILL SIENKIEWICZ, DAVID MACK, JASON SHAWN ALEXANDER, JIM MAHFOOD, SATINE PHOENIX, JAW COOPER AND STEPHANIE INAGAKI, there's no way we can do this without your help!
A quick note on the "Augmented" graphic novel concept. 
As we traverse each stretch goal, both the Hardcover and LTD Edition versions of PUNCH will increase in size from their original 48 pages. Each stretch goal will generate a complete Four Page increase in the size of the comic, from 48 pages to 52, 56, etc. (4 pages, fully painted, colored, and lettered)

 The creative process behind PUNCH is somewhat different to how things are traditionally done. I wanted to bring my photography skills to bear on this project, so early on I decided to cast the comic as though I would a film; primarily as reference for the many artists involved, but also to create a distinctive visual scaffolding to hang the story on. An elite band of actors and models lent their prowess, personality and charisma to the characters. Jonathan Marks Barravecchia is then using the reference imagery to paint each and every panel of PUNCH by hand. In addition to making each piece of the narrative a bonafide work of art, it also creates the perfect gritty atmosphere for the story to take place.

are just some of the incredible artists on board, creating epic cover art, pin ups and splash pages based on the reference images of the amazing cast.

 Grab an oar, and climb aboard Charon's Ferry!
As a first time writer and creator of graphic novels, I nonetheless intend to bring my extensive Kickstarter acumen to bear on this project. For everything else, I intend to rely on the expert collaborators I've gathered from across the comics multiverse, and I'd like to invite you to learn alongside me. Come behind the scenes, learn directly about what goes into the publication of a comic book - from script development, to artwork, printing and distribution.
Whether you're contributing $5 for a digital edition of the comic or several hundred dollars for an original art piece, I want to give all of your the opportunity be part of the PUNCH. Whether its Facebook Live chatting with the epic contributors and models, seeing the storyboards come alive in real time, or staggering through the quagmire that is the printing process, I'd like to bring you all on the journey from concept to completion!
Thank you all for supporting our foray into Indie comic book publishing!
 Celebrity photographer, ALLAN AMATO has spent years taking photos and making them more than real. Showing both grit and beauty. That keen eye will be turned to the medium of Graphic Novels. Each page, a tome of visuals to tell the stories as much with images as dialogue. Making for an immersive living world within the comic.
Jason Shawn Alexander and Allan Amato
Thomas Jane by Allan Amato
Ricky Whittle by Allan Amato
JOHNATHAN MARKS BARRAVECCHIA is an artist and illustrator who has worked for companies such as Marvel and Aspen Comics, and has shown his work in galleries in the US, UK, and Australia. His latest self-published graphic novel is Mariner: An Ancient Rime, an oversized and fully painted 90 page comic available summer of 2020. More of his work, and pictures of his dog, can be found at @jonathanmarksart on instagram.
Jonathan Marks Barrevecchia
 CLEM ROBINS began working professionally in comics lettering for Gold Key comics in 1977. It would be easier to list the comics he hasn’t lettered. But some superhero comics he’s lettered include X-Men, Spider-Man, Superman, Batman, Green Lantern, The Fantastic Four, Wolverine, Teen Titans, Deadman, The Creeper, Hulk, Conan, The Sovereign Seven, and the Justice League.
He lettered the recent ten-issue miniseries “Kamandi Challenge”, which DC Comics released to commemorate the centennary of Jack Kirby’s birth. Other recent projects include 2016’s Batman/Shadow crossover, Frank Miller’s Dark Knight miniseries, and Neal Adams’ recent seven-issue Deadman series. He is currently lettering the followup to that series, a matchup between Batman and Ra’s Al Ghul.
He’s done a lot of edgy material for DC’s horror imprint Vertigo, including Preacher, which has been adapted into an AMC TV series, Y: The Last Man, 100 Bullets, Transmetropolitan, The Losers, the Human Target, Animal Man, Black Orchid, and many others. His work on 100 Bullets was nominated for the 2004 Harvey Award.
For the last fifteen years, he’s handled all of Mike Mignola’s Hellboy and Hellboy-related titles for Dark Horse Comics.  
ARTIST - Jonathan Marks Barrevecchia /COLORIST - Lee Loughridge /LETTERER - Clem Robins

Every dollar will be put towards production, page rates for artists, colorist and letterer, and the original art for covers and pin ups. All in service to making sure the process is as smooth as possible, and that we are ready to put your pledges in play the moment the project funds.

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
Thank you all so much for contributing to Second Coming, we are almost there!!!
To celebrate, I was thinking we do a competition for Punch 01 only:
For the next 24 hours, everyone who pledges or has already pledged to PUNCH II, message me there (Punch:Second Coming page) with something vaguely aspirational - I'm on 6 hours of sleep in 3 days, so anything positive would be just grand - and one of you will win a signed one of a kind 12x16 David Mack print of Riley Reid!

And I just found out Mike Mignola might be doing some art!!!!! Ugh, so hard not to lose my mind at that, but I'm not celebrating until it actually happens...
You all have the Kickstarter to yourselves for the next couple hours, I'd love to hear what you think of everything! I really pulled out the stops on this one; A-list actors, After Effects, and an original music composition, and that's just the f#*king video! (I've always wanted to swear with stars and hash tags)
thank you all for your support!!
Allan

Hey everyone!
Almost all of the rewards have gone out in record time, I'm happy to say, and the 40 or so that remain are due out over the next 2-3 days, so despair not if you've yet to receive yours.
Well the big news is Punch 02 has been cleared for launch at noon on June 11th, though I'll only be promoting starting at 2pm, so 2 hours for any of you interested in those early birds!

Hey Everyone!
Punch has landed at Fulfillment, and the first 100 are already slated to go out tomorrow! The pedal is all the way to the floor for this fulfillment, and I'm hopeful everyone will have their reward within the next 2 weeks. 
Ricky Whittle, anyone?

Hey all,
Punch has arrived at port in LA, and is due to clear Customs next week. I have Fulfillment on standby, and am ready to blast these out to you the moment they're delivered to the warehouse. campaign.story:
Meet POPIN™ - The Ultimate, Urban Playground
POPIN is the ideal set up for the modern, eco-friendly family. It's an indoor-intended playground made of recycled materials that grows into full-sized fun when it's play time, and folds up for super-easy storage when you transition to adult time. The combination of design, durability, and fold-ability make for a safe and reliable pop-up playground that helps instill creativity in your little ones. 







POPIN Playgrounds are made of our proprietary double flute, reinforced corrugated cardboard, basically, our toys are super-strong. They're also incredibly durable and can support up to 110 lbs (50kg). 
Each POPIN Toy is designed with our innovative StrongFold™ technology. We used unique and cutting-edge folding methods based on traditional origami and pop-up artwork to produce high-quality, stable and safety-first folding playgrounds. 




















POPIN helps to develop symbolic play skills and ignite creativity by encouraging communication and active play. Each toy is designed to spark self-expression, stimulate gross motor skills, and stretch your child's imagination. Put all the toys together, and POPIN becomes a full indoor playground that promotes growth and development. 




We know every square inch of space counts, that's why we designed POPIN to fit in the smallest of spaces- so they're totally out of sight whenever you need them to be. 






Thanks to POPIN's light weight and convenient fold-ability, you can easily transport and store your playground pretty much anywhere.















We've already done a first run of our products. 500+ POPIN Toys have been shipped, and have been in our customers' homes for more than 2 years. During which, we've listened to feedback from our users and have perfected every feature of POPIN Playgrounds. Everything- from the StrongFold™ System to the materials we meticulously selected- has been carefully constructed to ensure safety and ultimate play-ability.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
JANKY could run away, get kidnapped, or arrested for vandalism. He/she might decide that the moon is a happy place.

Our factory might deliver toys later than expected, which means you'd get them a bit after the projected delivery date. We've worked with the same family of toy makers for years, so we're not too concerned about this.

Our freight container could sink on its way across the ocean. That would suck.

We may add or remove designs from the JANKY series for production reasons — but we probably won't. Some of the designs, colors, and surface textures will certainly change a bit in production, but they'll still be awesome. The toy heights mentioned may not be exactly as mentioned. 

Finally: We can't precisely control the number of limited edition toys produced because of the way Kickstarter works, so we'll take toys down well before they sell out. In addition, Superhero backers aren't included in the count totals because their aren't too many of 'em, and they are heroes who are backing us to the core! We'll do our best to keep the numbers close to the quoted limits, of course!!

But no matter what, everything will be brilliant and YOU WILL LOVE YOUR TOYS. Promise.

JANKY say relax.

Loves to alls,

Paul & Huck

PS: Much gratitude to Elan Lee and Exploding Kittens for kind advice and inspiring our campaign!

campaign.story:
THE PROJECT
A single volume pop-up book complete with scroll, printable paper craft activities (including coloring book pages, cut and assemble activities and 3D sculptures), and animations based on the Struwwelpeter by Heinrich Hoffman.
BACKGROUND 
I'm an artist who makes things: pop-up books, animations, things for the internet, things with electronics, and more. Several years ago, I decided to make a series of handmade editioned books (accordion, pop-up, carousel, tunnel, and more) based on Heinrich Hoffman's "Der Struwwelpeter." The children in this classic storybook collection encounter such disastrous consequences for their misbehavior, I was completely inspired!
Hand-made edition accordion pop-up book of Shockheaded Peter.
Handmade tunnel book from The Story of Little Suck-A-Thumb
My books have been exhibited internationally and can be found in museum, library, and personal collections all over the world. This is wonderful. (Thank you, Maddy Rosenberg and CENTRAL BOOKING!) That said, I realized that most of my friends can rarely see, much less own, the books themselves, because handmade books are so labor intensive, are in limited editions, and exhibited in very specific venues.
THE STRUWWELPETER
In 1845 Heinrich Hoffman created Der Struwwelpeter for his son in response to what he perceived to be a lack of good children’s books. The book became widely popular among children and adults. 
The ten stories include: Shockheaded Peter (lack of personal grooming leads to unpopularity); The Story of Cruel Frederick (if you are a bully, someone will bite back); The Story of Little Suck-A-Thumb (if you suck your thumb, the evil tailor will jump through the window and chop it off);  The Story of Augustus Who Would Not Eat His Soup (if you don't eat what you are given, you will starve to death and die); The Story of the Inky Boys (a tale of racism that has been adapted for this 21st century retelling); The Story of Pauline and the Matches (if you play with fire you will burn to death); The Story of the Man Who Went Out Hunting (if you go out hunting, the animals will fight back); The Story of Fidgety Phillip (if you don't still at the table, terrible accidents occur); The Story of Johny Head in the Air (if you don't watch where you are going, accidents  will occur); and The Story of Flying Robert (if you go out in the rain, the wind will pick you up and carry you away forever.)
THE KICKSTARTER: TO FUND A SINGLE-VOLUME POP-UP BOOK
I have decided to make and self-publish a single-volume collection containing all 10 stories so that everyone can have their own copy!
To do that, I am taking all the original artwork and re-imagining each of the original books into a single spread. Here are some samples:
Shockheaded Peter
The Story of Pauline and the Matches
Sample Pop-Up Spread of the Story of Johnny Head in the Air
DIY PAPERCRAFT ACTIVITIES
In addition to the single volume pop-up book, I have also created coloring book pages and DIY paper craft activities so that anyone can build their own Shockheaded Peter toys, sculptures, and more. 
Coloring Book Pages
Shockheaded Peter 3D Paper Craft
ANIMATIONS
As an added bonus, I animated each story (with music composed by both myself and the amazing Ithai Benjamin.) The animations are available from the pop-up book itself through AR or through a complete digital copy of the book.
PLAY

Shock-Headed Peter Animation Description: Just look at him! there he stands, With his nasty hair and hands. [Animation of crowd staring at Peter in circus tent] See! his nails are never cut; They are grimed as black as soot; [Animation of hand with long filthy nails underneath a magnifying glass] And the sloven, I declare, Never once has combed his hair; [Animation of Peter standing before a mirror, looking quite unkept] Anything to me is sweeter Than to see Shock-headed Peter. [Animation of Peter once again in circus tent breaking through bars to the horror of onlookers shielding their eyes and faces.]
PLAY

The Story of Flying Robert Animation Description: When the rain comes tumbling down, In the country or the town, All good little girls and boys, Stay at home and mind their toys. [Animation of traditional home in the rain] Robert thought, - "No, when it pours, It is better out of doors." Rain it did, and in a minute, Bob was in it. Here you see him, silly fellow, Underneath his big umbrella. [Animation of Robert walking in the rain, carrying a big umbrella and wearing a fisherman's hat] What a wind! Oh! how it whistles Through the trees and flow'rs and thistles. It has caught his big umbrella; Now look at him, silly fellow. [Animation of Robert standing, holding his umbrella against the wind, as leaves and rain come towards him. Eventually his hat flies off.] Up he flies, To the skies. No one heard his screams and cries; Through the clouds the rude wind bore him, And his hat flew on before him. [Animation of the wind picking Robert up and carrying him off the ground.] Soon they got to such height, They were nearly out of sight! And the hat went Up so high, That it almost touch'd the sky. [Animation of Robert floating higher and higher in the air.] No one ever yet could tell Where they stopp'd, or where they fell; Only this one thing is plain, Rob was never seen again! [Animation of a tiny silhouette of Robert high in the air, off in the distance.]
Animation activated from Pop-Up book and playing on phone

PROTOTYPES AND DEMONSTRATIONS
Last year, I demo'd the prototypes at New York Maker Faire with the wonderfully talented Jody Culkin. Our table "Telling Stories with 21st Century Pop-Up Books" got a lot of attention! 
Crowd surrounding demonstration of books at Maker Faire New York
Featured on Make and Makezine!
We won both an Editor’s Choice and a Best in Class ribbon! Plus, we were featured on the Make website and Gareth Branwyn wrote a lovely review on MakeZine. 
VISITING FACTORIES
This past fall, through the generosity of my incredible friends Matthew Belanger and Dee Hu, I got to visit printing and paper assembly factories in Guangzhou, China. I visited several factories to familiarize myself with the process, compare quality, and observe conditions. It was amazing to see the process of books being made first-hand and I picked a factory I feel really good about So ... we're ready to go.
With Dee at the factories!
MY GOAL
The money I’m raising will be used to cover the print and hand assembly costs for a minimum run of 3,000 books. The final book will be 8"x10"x1.25" and will contain a scroll that is 8.4"x33.8.
If the goal is met, I'll move forward -- which means signing a contract, delivering all the files complete with original art, die cuts, etc. The factory will then send me a mockup sample, and once approved the book goes into production.
I will need to ship the books from China to the United States. I will then work with a fulfillment company which will be responsible for storing and delivering book orders. Selling 1000 books would be the minimum number of books for the fulfillment company of my choice.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've done a lot of research and have chosen a factory that is known to do extremely high quality work. I've also tried to set a reasonable delivery date, incorporating the factory's turn-around time, time spent in shipping, customs, etc. That said, international geopolitics may have an unforeseen impact. Additionally, making and assembling 3000 units of anything at anytime can present challenges. If the project is funded, I will make sure to invest in quality assurance testing and other product control tools, track the product as closely as possible, and keep all backers informed as to each step (and challenge) along the way.

campaign.story:
UPDATE, GLORIOUS UPDATE:
ALL THREE OF OUR TITLES ARE FULLY FUNDED! We are going to produce each of these wonderful books. Thank you, friends. Your passion and support make magic possible.
If you want some combination of books and rewards for which there is no tier package, just message us directly and we'll give you a customized pledge level!
Thank you for supporting...
Great literary works of the past, illustrated and designed by the finest graphic artists, illustrators and cartoonists in the world, presented in lush, over-sized hardcover volumes.
At Beehive Books, we have always admired great book-craft -- especially the beautiful turn-of-the-century volumes of fiction, poetry and prose embellished by masters like Arthur Rackham, Gustave Dore, Rockwell Kent and countless other luminaries from the first golden age of illustration. Handsome volumes with hand-sewn signatures, tipped-in plates and sterling print quality.
Such gorgeous illustrated literature has become a rare bird in the quick-and-dirty landscape of modern mass production. 
So we're launching this series of classic literary masterworks, full to the brim with stunning artwork by the greatest visual storytellers in the world, in cloth-bound heirloom editions designed to be read and reread, experienced, and treasured.
We're partnering with three of the very finest artists working today: Paul Pope, Yuko Shimizu and Bill Sienkiewicz. We've asked each of the three what book they would most love to illustrate, and they've each come up with a fascinating choice. 
These are dream projects for these artists -- to work with some of their favorite literature, in print volumes with the highest production values.
So, without further ado...
Each edition will be designed by Maëlle Doliveux in close consultation and collaboration with its illustrator. While our concept hearkens back to the intricate book-craft of years past, these are not fusty faux-Victorian recreations of an antiquated aesthetic. These are modern high-design art objects, created utilizing the most cutting edge ideas and technologies in presentation and production. 
They will feature:
Expansive 9x12" trim size
Lush, textured, heavyweight paper
Cloth binding
A minimum of ten full-page, full-color illustrations
Die-cut slipcases, embossed & debossed with metallic foil blocking
Dyed edges
Some of the most beautiful artwork you'll ever lay your eyes on
Now let's talk about our titles.
Algernon Blackwood is one of the most important authors in the history of weird fiction and literary horror, and his work deserves to be universally recognized. 
His turn-of-the-century occult sagas of the natural and supernatural world had a huge impact on many 20th century masters....
...including H.P. Lovecraft, who believed that his masterwork THE WILLOWS was the greatest supernatural tale in all of English literature.
THE WILLOWS is a chilling and gorgeous story of two friends rafting down the flooded Danube, and slowly becoming deranged by a mysterious force at work on the branch-choked river. But in the 110 years since its original publication, it's floated in and out of print, without the wide recognition it deserves.
Who better than the modern master Paul Pope (BATTLING BOY, BATMAN: YEAR 100), whose energetic brush line seems to writhe and vibrate on the page, to illustrate and illuminate this tale of a raging river become astonishingly, malevolently conscious, and two human souls perched on the brink of madness?
With this book, we intend to create the most lavish and beautiful Algernon Blackwood edition ever produced.
As we're doing with Herbert Crowley in our upcoming art book THE TEMPLE OF SILENCE, we hope to pull another great genius from the brink of relative obscurity.
But Paul's beautiful book is only the first of the three editions available through this campaign.
Oscar Wilde's fairy tales are some of his most elegant and charming pieces of writing. 
He produced two books of fairy tales -- The Happy Prince and The Selfish Giant. They've rarely been collected in one volume -- and never with stunning artwork by Yuko Shimizu (THE UNWRITTEN, BARBED WIRE BASEBALL), one of the modern masters of illustration and graphic art.
Wilde's original fairy tales are moving, sweet, sad and magical -- much like Yuko's artwork. Yuko is one of the most celebrated and admired editorial illustrators in the world, and her work is perfectly aligned with Wilde's witty, rueful voice.
Yuko approached us with this book in mind. She's passionate about Wilde, and eager to follow her intricate, calligraphic line deep into his enchanted world. 
And so are we.
Has there ever been a better synthesis of artist and subject than the great Bill Sienkiewicz (a master of mutants if there ever was one) and H.G. Wells' classic THE ISLAND OF DOCTOR MOREAU? 
Before Bill even began work on his jaw-dropping illustrations, we knew this one would be a masterpiece. Wells' gleefully blasphemous tale of human chimeras and deranged scientific curiosity comes to nightmarish life through Billy the Sink's supreme brushwork and unmatched vision. 
Bill, for the few who aren't aware, is a living legend -- the man who almost single-handedly brought fine art techniques into mainstream comics, drew many of the most acclaimed comics and graphic novels of of the last 40 years, who collaborated with Alan Moore, Neil Gaiman and Frank Miller on some of their most ambitious works. 
Bill is simply one of the best visual storytellers of all time, and it's an honor to have this opportunity to work with him.
 We have produced limited edition high-end giclée prints of each image created exclusively for this campaign. Every print will be signed by the artist, numbered in a run of 100, and printed in archival ink on archival fine art velvet paper.
In order to show the vast potential of this ongoing line of Illuminated Editions, we've also commissioned additional illustrations from two of our favorite visual artists: Lisk Feng and Ronald Wimberly.
Below are the highly exclusive signed prints by Ron, Lisk, Bill, Paul and Yuko.
Lisk Feng's MOBY DICK illustration
Ronald Wimberly's visualization of William Blake's "The Voice of the Devil."
Bill Sienkiewicz's ISLAND OF DOCTOR MOREAU illustration
Yuko Shimizu's illustration of THE HAPPY PRINCE, one of Oscar Wilde's fairy tales
Paul Pope's THE WILLOWS illustration
$130,000: BOOKMARKS... UNLOCKED!!!
Lovely die-cut bookmarks for each of our three titles. We'll include all three of them them with every signed & numbered slipcase package, and as a $5 add-on for lower tier rewards.
$150,000: DIE STRUCK PINS... UNLOCKED!
We want to turn Yuko's gorgeous swallow into a 1.25" die-struck enamel pin, designed by Maëlle. A pin will be included for free with every order that includes a signed & numbered slipcase edition, as a $15 add on for lower level rewards, and as its own separate reward tier.  
$175,000: RIBBONS!
 If we hit $170,000, every edition we produce for this campaign will be equipped with a colored soft cloth ribbon, which will allow you to keep your place in the text without unsightly dog-earing. (Have I mentioned that you're expressly forbidden from dog-earing these books? It's like removing a tag from a mattress.)
PAUL POPE is an American artist/designer living and working in New York City. He has been working primarily in comics and screenprinting since the early '90s, but has also done a number of projects with Italian fashion label Diesel Industries and, in the US, with DKNY. HIs recent collaboration with Errolson Hugh/Acronym for Nike’s AF1 debuted spring 2017. His media clients include LucasArts, NBC, Disney, Cartoon Network, Marvel Comics, DC Comics, Conde-Naste, Kodansha (Japan), Sapporo (Japan), Dargaud Editions (France), EMI Canada, The Grateful Dead Estate, and The British Film Institute. His iconic Batman: Year 100, a science fiction take on the classic Batman origin tale, appears frequently on many Top 10 Batman story lists. In 2010 Pope was recognized as a Master Artist by the American Council Of The Arts. His short science fiction comic strip Strange Adventures (DC Comics)--an homage to the Flash Gordon serials of the '30s-- won the coveted National Cartoonist Society's Reuben Award for Best Comic Book of the year. He has won 5 Eisners to date. His latest book, Battling Boy, debuted at #1 on the New York Times best-seller list, his third book to hit the NYT Top 10.
He is currently working on Battling Boy 2, the second book in the epic science fiction/fantasy series for First Second/MacMillan, featuring a young superhero, and also finishing Psychenaut, a book of visual essays about Jungian dream analysis, for Dargaud Editions. Battling Boy is currently in feature development at Paramount Pictures, with Patrick Osborne attached to direct.
YUKO SHIMIZU is a Japanese illustrator based in New York City and instructor at School of Visual Arts. Newsweek Japan has chosen Yuko as one of “100 Japanese People The World Respects" in 2009. 
Her first self-titled monograph came out in 2011 (Gestalten), and her second was released from ROADS Publishing in spring of 2016. Other books include: A Wild Swan (collaboration with novelist Michael Cunningham, FSG, 2015) and a multi award winning children’s book Barbed Wire Baseball (written by Marissa Moss, Abrams, 2013). 
You may have seen her work on The Gap T-shirts, Pepsi cans, VISA billboards, Microsoft and Target ads, as well as on the book covers of Penguin, Scholastic, DC Comics, and on the pages of NY Times, Time, Rolling Stone, New Yorker and in many other publications over last ten years.
BILL SIENKIEWICZ (pronounced sin-KEV-itch) is an Eisner-winning, Emmy-nominated artist best known for revamping the style of comic and graphic novel illustration from 1980 onward, most notably with Marvel Comics' Elektra: Assassin and his acclaimed graphic novel Stray Toasters, earning him an international reputation and cult status across media industries.
His work has graced the National Museum of Fine Arts in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil; galleries in Paris, Barcelona and Tuscany; Spain's famed La Semana Negra (The Black Week) Festival; advertising campaigns for Nike, MTV and Nissan; posters for The Green Mile and 2006 Winter Olympics; and magazines such as Entertainment Weekly and Spin.
A classically-trained painter, Sienkiewicz's renderings incorporate abstract and expressionist influences and any combination of oil painting, acrylics, watercolor, mixed-media, collage and mimeograph - previously unheard of in comics. His work has garnered numerous accolades - most notably a 2004 Eisner Award for DC Comics' The Sandman: Endless Nights, and 1995 and 1996 Emmy Award nominations for production and character design on the PBS children's TV series Where In the World is Carmen Sandiego? Elektra: Assassin swept the top comic illustration awards in the U.S., Europe and Italy, respectively, with a 1987 Kirby Award, 1986 Yellow Kid Award, and 1986 Gran Guigiri Award.
BEEHIVE BOOKS is a Philadelphia-based boutique publisher newly founded by the artist and designer Maëlle Doliveux, and editor and author Josh O’Neill, co-publisher of Kickstarter-funded Locust Moon Press projects like THE LOST WORK OF WILL EISNER and the Eisner and Harvey Award-winning anthology LITTLE NEMO: DREAM ANOTHER DREAM. 
Beehive is committed to producing book art editions of distinctive literary and pictorial works with singular design sensibilities, the highest production values, and a special emphasis on comics and graphic art. This is their second project, following THE TEMPLE OF SILENCE: FORGOTTEN WORKS & WORLDS OF HERBERT CROWLEY.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As co-publisher of the Eisner and Harvey Award-winning LITTLE NEMO: DREAM ANOTHER DREAM project, Beehive Books co-founder Josh O’Neill knows well the challenges associated with funding, printing, and distributing beautiful oversized art books. Along with his partners at Locust Moon, Josh has raised over $300,000 over the course of his last three projects, and rewarded backers of each with very beautiful books and rewards. Armed with that experience we feel very ready to tackle the task of producing and publishing substantial, handsome volumes befitting their brilliant authors and illustrators.

We've carefully priced out expenses for domestic and overseas shipping, as well as printing costs for all books, prints and ancillary rewards. We’ve arranged for the logistics of reward fulfillment. We know exactly how much money we need to get this project across the finish line. All we need is the funding necessary to finish the job.

There are more risks and challenges involved in making books with this level of production value than I can realistically list here. Don't believe anybody who tells you this stuff is easy. Problems can and will pop up in ways we can't predict. But we have the knowledge, experience and commitment to persevere through difficulties and deliver a product that meets and exceeds the exacting expectations of our audience of discerning readers and collectors.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys and Digital Editions are Out
updates.update_content:
OK pals -- we're making progress. 
All surveys are out, so if you haven't received one in your email, it probably got shuffled to your spam. If you didn't receive a survey, just go to illuminated.backerkit.com and you'll be able to log in with your email address.
We've also sent out our digital editions of all three titles, via Dropbox links in Kickstarter messages. This is the first time you all can see what we've been hard at work on for over two years! We would love to hear what you think.

updates.update_userinfo: Very First Copies Hot Off the Press!
updates.update_content:
Hello, beautiful friends!
We've got some unbelievably exciting stuff to share with you today. WE HAVE ADVANCE COPIES!!!

But first, a quick reminder that our new campaign to fund I WILL LIVE FOREVER, Maëlle Doliveux's book of masterful cut-paper comics, is ticking down its last weekend.

Hi pals!

Just dropping a line to let you know how things are progressing as this project chugs along. We have some mind blowing things to announce, and some difficulties we're working through. But rest assured that these things are coming along, and they get more beautiful and exciting every day.
First off: THE BOOKS ARE AT THE PRINTER! Maëlle and I have spent the better part of this month in a total production frenzy, getting these things dressed up and ready for church. We are so proud of how beautiful they look. Take a gander at some sample spreads, designed by Maëlle, featuring art by Paul, Bill and Yuko:

Hello, book people! 
Just a quick note from our churchtower base of operations in West Philadelphia, where wheels are starting to turn fast on production of our ILLUMINATED EDITIONS series. 
A lot is happening at once, and we thought we should keep you in the loop. Bill, Yuko and Paul have all finished their illustration portfolios, and have moved on to small elaborations like drop caps, endpapers, frontispieces and so on. These will be wrapped in the next week. Maëlle is is deeply immersed in her design laboratory (which for now is actually located in the Kickstarter's Brooklyn headquarters for the summer -- , working on this project and her own upcoming graphic novel). We're starting to receive proofs and dummies from our printer as we secure materials for the case and interiors. We go to print in just a few weeks. We've got a heck of a long way to go before we get there, but we're moving closer every day.

If you share our project on social media please use the #WilloKickstarter so we can stop by and say thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second ever production toy fully developed by us. Through our previous release we learned a good amount about the production process. Also, in the development of this project we have worked with industry insiders to try to plot out where we may run into issues during this project and corrected accordingly.

But, whenever you are going into production overseas you may run into some minor delays. (i.e. quality control, shipping, customs, etc.) But, we have worked some flex in our shipping date for those items to ensure an on time delivery. If any delays should arise we will be sure to send all backers an update so you know where we are with the project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

As you may have seen our Willo Plush Kickstarter was not lucky enough to be funded. While dealing with defeat is never easy, through this process we were overwhelmed with all the support the project received. So many of our backers were sharing and promoting the campaign with their followers. We want you to know that didn't go unnoticed!
As for the future of the plush. We are going to look at ways we can lower costs and see if there is a way we can bring this piece to life. We are also going to look at what we offered here on Kickstarter and see if we can make you a sweeter deal. So, after all that occurs we might be back! We will just have to see if we can build a stronger campaign. (If you have any suggestions on where you think we went wrong please let us know.)

campaign.story:
Hey Kickstarter,
Are you a Light Sleeper? Night Owl? Frequent Traveler? Napper?
Are you working crazy hours and feeling like you never have enough time to rest?
The problem we face in getting high quality, uninterrupted sleep is always the same: significant lifestyle changes.
Sleep mask can be a great solution. Just put it on, block out the light, and improve the quality of your sleep.
But, common eye masks take a one-size-fits-all approach. They don’t fit, are uncomfortable, and let light through (making it even harder to sleep).
So as industrial designers with over 10 years of experience, we made something better.
  Manta Sleep Mask is designed to upgrade your sleep & life with a personalized fit.
      Manta is the World’s 1st Modular Sleep Mask with FreeFit - so it molds to fit your unique face.
It works for 99% of all face shapes & gives you 100% blackout for your entire sleep cycle...energizing you for wherever life takes you when you wake up.
Regardless of your ethnicity, age, gender, nose shape, or preferred sleeping position, Manta’s patent-pending adjustable modular eye contours create the perfect seal - because it’s specifically tailored to you.
Side sleeper? Belly sleeper? Back sleeper?...we’ve got you covered.
        PLAY

Mark Webster (Authority Hacker) 

          PLAY

Tristan King (Blackbelt Commerce) 
  Patent-Pending Modular FreeFit
Experience the Comfort of a Personalized Fit
What if, instead of losing valuable hours of sleep (not to mention cash) trying dozens of different sleep masks, you got it right the first time?
Your work would improve, you’d have more energy to go out, and your body would feel stronger.
Manta Sleep Mask’s modular design, with Patent-Pending omniLAT™, offers an unprecedented level of adjustability that’s easy and intuitive to use.
Because the fit is tailored to you, there’s no extra pressure on your face.
  The Modular Eye Contours can be adjusted freely to create a customized fit for 99% of all face shapes - including yours.
        100% Total Darkness for the Entire 8 Hours
Sleep, Uninterrupted
What if you could sleep through the entire night without waking up even once? Imagine how much better rested you’d feel in the morning.
Thanks to the 100% total blackout of the Manta Sleep Mask, you won’t experience any light leakage, meaning you’ll finally be able to sleep through the night.
Regardless of your sleep position or the shape of your nose, Manta conforms to your face (and keeps the light out).
  Side sleeper? Belly sleeper? Back sleeper? We’ve got you covered.
      The luxurious foam contour snugly conforms to the sides of your face, making sleep on your side & belly more comfortable.
    There is NO light leakage with Manta.
  Eye Contours for REM Sleep
Spend Less Time Sleeping & Feel More Energetic
Rapid Eye Movement (REM) sleep is when your brain is repaired and renewed.
If you need more energy and want to feel well-rested in the morning, focus on getting more REM sleep.
During REM sleep, your eyes experience rapid movements in random directions. Most sleep masks press against your face and eyes, which can interrupt this process.
Manta has specially designed eye contours that encourage REM sleep.
Because there is no direct contact or pressure on your eyelids, your REM cycle won’t be interrupted.
   Eye contours do not press against your eyelids, which allow REM sleep to occur.
           Since we designed Manta Sleep Mask for ourselves, we went all out to bring you even more sleep-enhancing features.
   No more hair-pulling. No more pain. Micro velcro will not stick to your hair.
    Cotton interior ensures Breathability & Comfort. Manta feels Light & Cool.
    The 2 sections of the headband are made from elastics, which give you -extra comfort- as the product will STRETCH to fit your head. Limiting the elastics to only these 2 sections prevents the entire band from stretching loose with use.
    The total length of the product is 71cm, which will fit 99% of all head sizes. The strap is made out of plush cotton velour, so it’s soft & comfortable against your head and ears.
    Lightweight construction. Manta Sleep Mask is great to use while sitting up straight (such as on a plane).
    The silicone grip pad on the back of the mask prevents it from slipping off your head during sleep.
    Manta earplugs are made with memory foam to block out sound.
    You’re going to love the Manta Pouch. Its separated earplug compartment with a zipped closure ensures you’ll never lose your earplugs again.
      The mesh design has 2 advantages: 
The pouch doubles as a laundry mesh net, so you can machine wash your eye mask without damaging it. The mesh net will significantly extend the life of your Manta Mask. 
The pouch also airs out your Manta Sleep Mask when in storage or during your travels. This improves hygiene and prevents odor buildup.
  ALL YOU – YOUR WANDERLUST
What if you could take advantage of everything your travels have to offer, without running out of energy? Imagine how much more epic & memorable your adventures would be.
Traveling is very disruptive to your sleep quality. Those hours on a plane and adjusting to a new time zone leave you with low energy levels.
Seasoned travelers know that the trick is to catch sleep whenever and wherever you can - be it on the plane, bus, boat, or just a good old couch.
Unfortunately, sleeping conditions on the road are often less than ideal.
That’s where Manta Sleep Mask comes in.
           PLAY

Madaline Lorelle (Couple’s Quest)
ALL YOU – YOUR POWER NAP
What if, instead of getting coffee 3 times a day, you could get a sustained energy boost? You’d feel like a “million bucks” before even pitching that major deal.
Taking a 30-minute power nap is one of the best ways to recharge yourself in the middle of a busy day.
Despite the short duration, you wake up feeling sharper, stronger, & ready to close the deal.
The problem is, your body has trouble napping under fluorescent light found in the office. This is where Manta comes in.

Chris Kim (Hilltop Stores)
ALL YOU – YOUR ZEN
What if you could escape from a day of lazy lethargy without overdosing on energy drinks? Imagine how present you’d feel.
Meditation is an exercise for the soul, leading to increased mindfulness and better rest.
Unfortunately, distractions abound in our daily lives.
Every once awhile, it’s important to let go and to try to clear our minds. This is where Manta Sleep Mask comes in.

Jamon Yerger
ALL YOU – YOUR SLEEP-IN
If you only have one day to sleep in, the last thing you want is for the morning sun to wake you up before you’re ready.
Morning light coming in through the window is a major disruption to your sleep, especially if your body hasn’t had enough time to get fully rested.
With our modern lifestyle of going to bed well after sunset, it’s difficult, if not impossible, for our body to get enough rest before sunrise.
And let’s face it: we all just want to sleep in every once in awhile.
This is where Manta comes in.

What if you could feel rested and have a social life, even while working vampiric hours? Imagine how much healthier you’d be, both emotionally and physically.
According to WebMD, “there is strong evidence that shift work is related to a number of serious health conditions, like cardiovascular disease, diabetes, and obesity.”
Sleep disturbances and loss only worsen these conditions.
It’s extremely important for night shift workers to create total darkness during the day - and curtains alone simply aren’t enough.
This is where Manta comes in.

In these situations, all you can do is to maximize the sleep time that you do have and to upgrade your sleep quality.
How rested you feel doesn’t depend on just the duration of your sleep, but also on the quality of it.
The faster you can go into, and the longer you can stay in, REM sleep, the less amount of sleep you need.

campaign.story:
UPRIGHT GO is a tiny wearable device that improves your posture by vibrating every time you slouch. It also tracks your posture to the UPRIGHT app.
  Screen slouching is one of the main prices we pay for our modern lifestyle. Poor posture doesn’t just look bad, it has very real negative effects on the body and mind, causing back pain and diminishing confidence.
That's where UPRIGHT GO comes in. We’ve dedicated the last few years to crafting the most effective way to fight and correct this modern epidemic, and we're super proud to share our latest breakthrough with you.
                                                                                        Watch Ori, our Business Manager and Co-Founder, on i24 News .
We’re confident you’ll like it. So we’re offering you a 30-day full money back guarantee, no questions asked!  
Why are we so confident? Because it really works and we know it. Secondly, this isn’t our first campaign so we know what to expect with sales, shipping, delivery and every other step of the process.
 No-questions-asked returns. We know that self-improvement sometimes requires a bit of a push. So this is yours. Invest in yourself, try it, and see how it improves your life. Or you get your money back. See? No. More. Excuses.
    PLAY

     All UPRIGHT GO devices come with a sleek and compact hard shell case. The case is perfectly designed for UPRIGHT GO and ensures it's not damaged while you're on the go.
  UPRIGHT GO's double-sided soft stickers are durable and reusable, lasting an average of 15 applications, which lasts on average 2-3 weeks with regular use. The stickers are made from medical silicone and are hypoallergenic. They stick easily and comfortably and work well, even with hair and/or sweat. Each pack comes with 5 stickers, and they will also, of course, be available at an affordable price later on. 
*Please note: we'll contact you before we ship to see if you want to order more stickers or anything else.
                                                    UPRIGHT GO is our second posture trainer, our first one - the UPRIGHT PRO, was a huge success.
It's not just us that think so, these awards on our office shelf back up our claim.
  PLAY

 Since our last crowdfunding campaign was so much fun and such a positive learning experience, we decided to again share it with you here.
We're not hypothesizing here, we've got hard data and numbers to back up Upright Technology's effectiveness, and besides seeing the incredible transformations first hand, we had some 3rd party tests. Click below to learn more about studies and tests done with UPRIGHT.  
Click the image to download the whitepaper
    We could not have done any of this without every piece of our amazing team, an amazing group of passionate people dedicating their time to enable people to better help themselves. 
       Advertising done by Tross - a technology driven crowdfunding powerhouse.
                                                                                                                                                                                            Medical Disclaimer: UPRIGHT hopes to offer users information regarding his/her posture. The service does not constitute medical advice or professional service. The user should always consult with a qualified personal medical advisor. The device is not FDA approved.

As with any venture, and especially true for a Kickstarter campaign, there is always a risk. About Me:
I have been a professional illustrator for the past 14 years. If you’re not familiar with my work I’m sure you have seen some of the work I have created for clients. I have worked for Nickelodeon, Disney, Atlantic Records and Fisher Price. I have also animated music videos, which have had over 2 million viewers as well as shown in galleries throughout the NYC area. That’s actually where this journey began.
Please feel free to check out my website:
www.vincentscala.com
A few years ago I had created a few silkscreen projects for a gallery show in Brooklyn. The final result was two images that have sort of become my trademark. The idea behind them was to combine two things that are sort of dorky that I loved. Well my two were Disney and horror films. The final result was the Mickey Monster and Vampire Snow White.
Silkscreens
Gallery Show Postcard
Original Concept Sketch
Mickey Monster
Vampire Snow White
Me @ Bunnycutlet Gallery Opening !
Bunnycutlet Website!
 They both received a lot of attention and I kept getting contacted by other galleries and stores to have prints made for them, especially of the Mickey. The PIQ store in Grand Central Station used the image as the poster for their own Mickey Show. 
PIQ Poster
PIQ Store Mickey Show
Print Run
Recently I have been thinking about taking this piece a step further. Something that’s not just on your wall, but a physical Mickey Monster. I want to have this created into an actual toy. A vinyl figure with 3 points of articulation (moveable head and arms).  
Vinyl Colors Part 2
 I love collectible toys, and I love the idea of sharing my love of toys as well as for the Mickey Monster image with everyone is what brings me here today. Knowing that people like this image and character so much that they would want to have it on their shelf or desk is exactly why I love being an artist.
Studio Space
Vinyl Toys
3D Printed Prototypes
Unfortunately creating a toy is not so easy, and the cost of the mold and high order quantities and shipping. So basically the whole process is far from cheap. Having a large community of people who would be interested in having this toy would be the best way to help make this come alive. Not only would I be getting to have one of my favorite pieces created as a vinyl toy, but also I would be able to share it with the world. 
So Where Does the Money Go? If you are wondering who and what would need $7000 to create a toy, then look no further! Hope this helps answer some questions/concerns.
The most expensive portion of this venture is the mold. The mold gets created of of steel before being poured and spun with liquid vinyl. The molds are made out of steel. Since this is a complicated figure, the mold was a little pricey.
The second largest cost of creating this figure is the MOQ or minimum order quantity. The lowest amount I was able to have created to even have a factory look at this project is 1000 pieces. That seems like a lot of toys and it is!, but after all is said and done with the kickstarter hopefully there will not be many left !
